title: Cuban Missile Crisis Quiz
description: Thirteen days in October 1962 when the world held its breath. How well do you remember the Cuban Missile Crisis?

questions.question: In what month and year did the Cuban Missile Crisis occur?
How were the Soviet missile sites in Cuba first discovered?
What action did President Kennedy take to prevent more Soviet weapons from reaching Cuba?
Why did Kennedy call it a 'quarantine' instead of a 'blockade'?
options: A blockade was technically an act of war
It was a medical term for safety

questions.question: Who was the Soviet Premier during the Cuban Missile Crisis?
Who was the leader of Cuba during the crisis?
How many days did the crisis last?
What did the Soviets agree to do to resolve the crisis?
options: Allow UN inspections of all Soviet bases

questions.question: What secret concession did the U.S. make in return?
options: Lifting trade sanctions on the USSR

questions.question: Who served as Attorney General and close advisor to JFK during the crisis?
What was the U.S. military readiness level raised to during the crisis, the highest ever during the Cold War?
What famous phrase did Secretary of State Dean Rusk say when Soviet ships turned back?
options: 'We're eyeball to eyeball, and the other fellow just blinked'

questions.question: What was established between Washington and Moscow after the crisis to prevent future miscommunication?
What U.S. Air Force pilot was shot down and killed over Cuba during the crisis?
How did most Americans learn about the crisis?
options: Through Kennedy's televised address on October 22
